tool.name: tool_8

param.name: EIGEN_INPUT
param.dialogReference:
Eigen Vectors

Table, input, optional

optional

Use Eigen vectors from this table instead of calculating these from the input grids.

param.name: EIGEN
param.dialogReference:
Eigen Vectors

Table, output, optional

optional

Store calculated Eigen vectors to this table, e.g. for later use with forward or inverse PCA.

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] correlation matrix

[1] variance-covariance matrix

[2] sums-of-squares-and-cross-products matrix

Default: 1

param.name: COMPONENTS
param.dialogReference:
Number of Components

Integer

Minimum: 0

Default: 3

number of first components in the output; set to zero to get all

tool.summary: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for grids. PCA implementation is based on F.Murtagh's code as provided by the StatLib web site.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
